title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
With Covid-19 flaring up across China, major manufacturers are shutting factories, ports are clogging up and workers are in short supply as officials impose city lockdowns and mass testing.

Citadel Securities is set to receive its first outside investment in a deal valuing the electronic-trading firm majority-owned by hedge fund billionaire Ken Griffin at around $22 billion.

Boeing sold more aircraft than Airbus last year but delivered half as many passenger jets, in a sign of the changing landscape facing the plane makers.

Citigroup said it would exit its consumer-banking business in Mexico, marking the latest strategic shift by CEO Fraser.

A judge ruled the FTC can move forward with its revised antitrust case alleging that Meta's Facebook unit is abusing a monopoly position in social media.

Poet and activist Maya Angelou became the first Black woman to be featured on the U.S. quarter.

What's News: Business & Finance
